modulesApplication.views package¶

Package Overview¶

This package contains all of our web views, i.e. all the functionality of the website.

It is responsible for handling HTTP requests, and handles things like displaying different pages to the user, redirects, submitting forms, .etc .etc

modulesApplication.views.index¶

Views handling the user’s entry point into the application.

modulesApplication.views.index.index(request)¶

Displays the index page.

modulesApplication.views.index.login_redirect(request)¶

A view to handle redirection upon login.

Redirects students to the student-landing view, and staff to the staff-landing view.

modulesApplication.views.office¶

modulesApplication.views.office.csv_file(request, model_class)¶
modulesApplication.views.office.landing(request)¶
modulesApplication.views.office.print_student_selections(request)¶
modulesApplication.views.office.selection_requests(request)¶
modulesApplication.views.office.selections_extra_details(query_set)¶

modulesApplication.views.office_crud_views¶

A module containing various create/read/update/delete views allowing office staff to modify data.

These are all generic Django class-based views tailored to our application, and their purpose is self-explanatory.

Each ListView links to the relevant CRUD views.

See https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/ref/class-based-views/

modulesApplication.views.student¶

All the views relating to a student using the application.

modulesApplication.views.student.all_modules(request, sort=0)¶
modulesApplication.views.student.choice_pathway(request)¶

Handles a user wanting to choose their modules.

It attempts to derive the student’s degree and stage from LDAP, and takes them the choose_modules view if successful, or the choose_degree_and_stage view otherwise.

modulesApplication.views.student.choose_degree_and_stage(request)¶

Allows a user to choose their degree programme and stage. Useful if there is some sort of LDAP error meaning their programme/stage cannot be derived automatically, or if testing the site as a superuser.

modulesApplication.views.student.choose_modules(request, prog_code, stage, entry_year)¶

Allows a user to choose their modules. A GET request displays the form, and a POST request submits the form and redirects to the submitted view.

modulesApplication.views.student.landing(request)¶

Displays the student landing page.

modulesApplication.views.student.module_details(request, module)¶

Shows details of various modules.

modulesApplication.views.student.my_selection(request)¶

A view for the student to see their current ModuleSelection object.

modulesApplication.views.student.submitted(request, student_id, stage, entry_year, prog_code)¶

Builds a ModuleSelection object after the choose_modules form is submitted, and redirects the user to the my_selection view.
